Content:
[[Intangible cultural heritage]] ([[Ukrainian language|Ukrainian]]: '''Нематеріальна культурна спадщина''') are elements of the [[cultural heritage]] of [[Ukraine]] which are abstract and must be learned, encompassing [[traditional knowledge]] including festivals, music, performances, celebrations, handicrafts, and oral traditions.

Starting from 2013, five items are inscribed on the registry of Ukraine's Intangible Cultural Heritage as of March 2022. Four of them have been placed on the [[UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage Lists]], and the fifth - recognition of the unique culture of Ukrainian borscht cooking - was held in a backlog of nominations.<ref>{{Cite web |title=UNESCO - Ukraine |url=https://ich.unesco.org/en/state |access-date=2022-03-07 |website=ich.unesco.org |language=en}}</ref>

Diff:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -1,3 +1,4 @@
+{{Short description|UNESCO recognised cultural heritage}}
 [[Intangible cultural heritage]] ([[Ukrainian language|Ukrainian]]: '''Нематеріальна культурна спадщина''') are elements of the [[cultural heritage]] of [[Ukraine]] which are abstract and must be learned, encompassing [[traditional knowledge]] including festivals, music, performances, celebrations, handicrafts, and oral traditions.
 
 Starting from 2013, five items are inscribed on the UNESCO registry of Ukraine's Intangible Cultural Heritage as of July 2022,<ref>{{Cite web |title=Ukraine |url=https://ich.unesco.org/en/state/ukraine-UA |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220706095944/https://ich.unesco.org/en/state/ukraine-UA |archive-date=2022-07-06 |access-date=2023-10-05 |website=UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage}}</ref> and three items - Ukrainian pysanka, [[Preservation of kobzar music|safeguarding of the kobzar-lirnyk tradition]], and technology of white-on-white embroidery in Reshetylivka - were nominated in 2023.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-07-03 |title=Ukrainian Pysanka and Kobzar - Lirnyk traditions may be inscribed on the UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage Lists next year |url=https://www.kmu.gov.ua/en/news/ukrainska-pysanka-i-kobzarsko-lirnytski-tradytsii-mozhut-popovnyty-spysky-nematerialnoi-kulturnoi-spadshchyny-iunesko-vzhe-nastupnoho-roku |access-date=2023-10-05 |website=Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine}}</ref>

-Starting from 2013, six items are inscribed on the UNESCO registry of Ukraine's Intangible Cultural Heritage as of December 2024,<ref>{{Cite web |title=Ukraine |url=https://ich.unesco.org/en/state/ukraine-UA |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220706095944/https://ich.unesco.org/en/state/ukraine-UA |archive-date=2022-07-06 |access-date=2024-12-04 |website=UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage}}</ref> and four items — safeguarding programme of [[Kobzar|kobza]] and [[Lirnyk|wheel lyre tradition]], embroidery technique 'white-in white' of the town Reshetylivka in Poltava region, Rivne region tradition of the Polissia Dudka-Vykrutka, and Safeguarding practice of the "Tradition of the [[Malanka|Generous Evening]] in Ukraine" through formal and non-formal education — were nominated in 2023 and 2024.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-07-03 |title=Ukrainian Pysanka and Kobzar - Lirnyk traditions may be inscribed on the UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage Lists next year |url=https://www.kmu.gov.ua/en/news/ukrainska-pysanka-i-kobzarsko-lirnytski-tradytsii-mozhut-popovnyty-spysky-nematerialnoi-kulturnoi-spadshchyny-iunesko-vzhe-nastupnoho-roku |access-date=2023-10-05 |website=Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-03-28 |title= |script-title=uk:МКІП направило два подання на розгляд Міжурядовому Комітету з охорони нематеріальної культурної спадщини ЮНЕСКО |trans-title=The Ministry of Culture and Information Policy sent two submissions to the Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of UNESCO |url=https://mcip.gov.ua/news/mkip-napravylo-dva-podannya-na-rozglyad-mizhuryadovomu-komitetu-z-ohorony-nematerialnoyi-kulturnoyi-spadshhyny-yunesko/ |access-date=2024-05-20 |website=[[Ministry of Culture and Information Policy]]}}</ref>

+]] + +The [[UNESCO|United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation]] (UNESCO) [[intangible cultural heritage]] elements ({{Langx|uk|Нематеріальна культурна спадщина}}) are the non-physical traditions and practices performed by a people. As part of a country's [[cultural heritage]], they include celebrations, festivals, performances, oral traditions, music, and the making of handicrafts.{{cite web|url=https://ich.unesco.org/en/what-is-intangible-heritage-00003|title=What is Intangible Cultural Heritage?|publisher=[[UNESCO]] Intangible Cultural Heritage|access-date=13 January 2024}} The "intangible cultural heritage" is defined by the [[Convention for the Safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage]], drafted in 2003{{cite web|url=https://ich.unesco.org/en/convention|title=Text of the Convention for the Safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage|publisher=[[UNESCO]] Intangible Cultural Heritage|access-date=13 January 2024}} and took effect in 2006.{{cite web|title=The States Parties to the Convention for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage (2003)|url=https://ich.unesco.org/en/states-parties-00024|publisher=[[UNESCO]] Intangible Cultural Heritage|access-date=13 January 2024}} Inscription of new heritage elements on the [[UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage Lists]] for their protection and safeguard is determined by the Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage, an organisation established by the convention.{{cite web|title=Functions of the Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage|url=https://ich.unesco.org/en/functions-00586|access-date=13 January 2024|publisher=[[UNESCO]] Intangible Cultural Heritage}} + +Ukraine ratified the convention on 27 May 2008. Heritage}} and three items — embroidery technique 'white-in white' of the town Reshetylivka in Poltava region, Rivne region tradition of the Polissia Dudka-Vykrutka, and safeguarding practice of the  Ukraine ratified the convention on 27 May 2008. As of December 2024, seven items from Ukraine are inscribed on the UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity Lists,<ref>{{Cite web |title=Ukraine |url=https://ich.unesco.org/en/state/ukraine-UA |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220706095944/https://ich.unesco.org/en/state/ukraine-UA |archive-date=2022-07-06 |access-date=2024-12-06 |website=UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage}}</ref> and three items — embroidery technique 'white-in white' of the town Reshetylivka in Poltava region, Rivne region tradition of the Polissia Dudka-Vykrutka, and safeguarding practice of the "Tradition of the [[Malanka|Generous Evening]] in Ukraine" through formal and non-formal education — were nominated in 2023 and 2024.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-07-03 |title=Ukrainian Pysanka and Kobzar - Lirnyk traditions may be inscribed on the UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage Lists next year |url=https://www.kmu.gov.ua/en/news/ukrainska-pysanka-i-kobzarsko-lirnytski-tradytsii-mozhut-popovnyty-spysky-nematerialnoi-kulturnoi-spadshchyny-iunesko-vzhe-nastupnoho-roku |access-date=2023-10-05 |website=Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-03-28 |title= |script-title=uk:МКІП направило два подання на розгляд Міжурядовому Комітету з охорони нематеріальної культурної спадщини ЮНЕСКО |trans-title=The Ministry of Culture and Information Policy sent two submissions to the Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of UNESCO |url=https://mcip.gov.ua/news/mkip-napravylo-dva-podannya-na-rozglyad-mizhuryadovomu-komitetu-z-ohorony-nematerialnoyi-kulturnoyi-spadshhyny-yunesko/ |access-date=2024-05-20 |website=[[Ministry of Culture and Information Policy]]}}</ref> 
 
-The [[Ministry of Culture and Information Policy|Ministry of Culture of Ukraine]] has also formed the National Inventory of Elements of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Ukraine.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Про затвердження Порядку ведення Національного переліку елементів нематеріальної культурної спадщини України|url=https://zakon.rada.gov.ua/go/z0020-18|website=Офіційний вебпортал парламенту України|accessdate=2023-02-01|language=uk}}</ref> 
+The [[Ministry of Culture and Strategic Communications|Ministry of Culture of Ukraine]] has also formed the National Inventory of Elements of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Ukraine.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Про затвердження Порядку ведення Національного переліку елементів нематеріальної культурної спадщини України|url=https://zakon.rada.gov.ua/go/z0020-18|website=Офіційний вебпортал парламенту України|accessdate=2023-02-01|language=uk}}</ref>

]] The [[UNESCO|United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation]] (UNESCO) [[intangible cultural heritage]] elements ({{Langx|uk|Нематеріальна культурна спадщина}}) are the non-physical traditions and practices performed by a people. As part of a country's [[cultural heritage]], they include celebrations, festivals, performances, oral traditions, music, and the making of handicrafts.{{cite web|url=https://ich.unesco.org/en/what-is-intangible-heritage-00003|title=What is Intangible Cultural Heritage?|publisher=[[UNESCO]] Intangible Cultural Heritage|access-date=13 January 2024}} The "intangible cultural heritage" is defined by the [[Convention for the Safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage]], drafted in 2003{{cite web|url=https://ich.unesco.org/en/convention|title=Text of the Convention for the Safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage|publisher=[[UNESCO]] Intangible Cultural Heritage|access-date=13 January 2024}} and took effect in 2006.{{cite web|title=The States Parties to the Convention for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage (2003)|url=https://ich.unesco.org/en/states-parties-00024|publisher=[[UNESCO]] Intangible Cultural Heritage|access-date=13 January 2024}} Inscription of new heritage elements on the [[UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage Lists]] for their protection and safeguard is determined by the Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage, an organisation established by the convention.{{cite web|title=Functions of the Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage|url=https://ich.unesco.org/en/functions-00586|access-date=13 January 2024|publisher=[[UNESCO]] Intangible Cultural Heritage}} Ukraine ratified the convention on 27 May 2008. As of December 2024, seven items from Ukraine are inscribed on the UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity Lists,{{Cite web |title=Ukraine |url=https://ich.unesco.org/en/state/ukraine-UA |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220706095944/https://ich.unesco.org/en/state/ukraine-UA |archive-date=2022-07-06 |access-date=2024-12-06 |website=UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage}} and three items — embroidery technique 'white-in white' of the town Reshetylivka in Poltava region, Rivne region tradition of the Polissia Dudka-Vykrutka, and safeguarding practice of the "Tradition of the [[Malanka|Generous Evening]] in Ukraine" through formal and non-formal education — were nominated in 2023 and 2024.{{Cite web |date=2023-07-03 |title=Ukrainian Pysanka and Kobzar - Lirnyk traditions may be inscribed on the UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage Lists next year |url=https://www.kmu.gov.ua/en/news/ukrainska-pysanka-i-kobzarsko-lirnytski-tradytsii-mozhut-popovnyty-spysky-nematerialnoi-kulturnoi-spadshchyny-iunesko-vzhe-nastupnoho-roku |access-date=2023-10-05 |website=Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine}}{{Cite web |date=2024-03-28 |title= |script-title=uk:МКІП направило два подання на розгляд Міжурядовому Комітету з охорони нематеріальної культурної спадщини ЮНЕСКО |trans-title=The Ministry of Culture and Information Policy sent two submissions to the Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of UNESCO |url=https://mcip.gov.ua/news/mkip-napravylo-dva-podannya-na-rozglyad-mizhuryadovomu-komitetu-z-ohorony-nematerialnoyi-kulturnoyi-spadshhyny-yunesko/ |access-date=2024-05-20 |website=[[Ministry of Culture and Information Policy]]}} The [[Ministry of Culture and Strategic Communications|Ministry of Culture of Ukraine]] has also formed the National Inventory of Elements of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Ukraine.{{Cite web|title=Про затвердження Порядку ведення Національного переліку елементів нематеріальної культурної спадщини України|url=https://zakon.rada.gov.ua/go/z0020-18|website=Офіційний вебпортал парламенту України|accessdate=2023-02-01|language=uk}} == Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity == {{Legend|#D0E7FF|Transnational element|outline=silver|text=+}} === Representative List === {|class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" ! style="width:25%" | Name ! class="unsortable"| Image ! No. ! class="unsortable"| Description |- | [[Petrykivka painting|Petrykivka decorative painting]] as a phenomenon of the Ukrainian ornamental folk art | [[File:Blue flowers box.jpg|150px|Painted box]] | 2013 | 00893 | It is a traditional [[Ukrainian culture|Ukrainian]] decorative painting style, originating from the [[Populated places in Ukraine#Rural settlements|rural settlement]] of [[Petrykivka]] in [[Dnipropetrovsk Oblast]], where it was traditionally used to decorate house walls and everyday household items.{{cite web |title=Petrykivka decorative painting as a phenomenon of the Ukrainian ornamental folk art |url=https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/petrykivka-decorative-painting-as-a-phenomenon-of-the-ukrainian-ornamental-folk-art-00893 |website=[[UNESCO]]}} |- | Tradition of [[Kosiv painted ceramics]] | [[File:Kraina Mriy DSCN2171.jpg|150px|Kosiv painted ceramics]] | 2019 | 01456 | The distinctive painted ceramics from [[Kosiv]] originated in the 1700s and reflect the history and culture of [[Hutsuls|Hutsul]] people.{{Cite web |title=UNESCO - Tradition of Kosiv painted ceramics |url=https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/tradition-of-kosiv-painted-ceramics-01456 |website=[[UNESCO]]}} |- | [[Örnek (ornament)|Örnek]], a Crimean Tatar ornament and knowledge about it | [[File:Adaviye_Efendiyeva_01.JPG|150px|Adaviye Efendiyeva design]] | 2021 | 01601 | It is a design of ornamentation, which is used on embroidery, weaving, pottery, engraving, jewellery, wood carving, and glass and wall painting; the listing also includes knowledge and understanding of the practice.{{cite web |title=Ornek, a Crimean Tatar ornament and knowledge about it |url=https://ich.unesco.org/en/RL/ornek-a-crimean-tatar-ornament-and-knowledge-about-it-01601 |website=[[UNESCO]]}} |- !
